section.name: Introduction to NYX
section.p: The main goals of NYX is to provide an easy way to create frontends. The Frontend API that will result from the development of NYX will provide an easy way to migrate current application to NYX and reuse the components that are already created or used by that application. The API allows easy integration of widgets and gui layers, rule engines and dataproviders. We aim to provide a default set of implementations to get a professional frontend up and running in no time and this way provide an easy look into the workings of NYX. Please understand that this is a work in progress and by far doesn't yet offer the functionality specified above. Also much of the documentation that is provided is what is meant to be and not necessarily what is (yet). Please have a look at the features page to see in more detail what we are going to provide.

section.name: What's up with the name??
section.p:
My main goal (not in life btw ;) is to get xulux up and running, but I just haven't found the time yet to make time available to make the "perfect" solution, I started to solve some immediate problems. Since the project could be usefull for the xulux project in terms of learning experience (at least for me), it just isn't xulux yet. To not mess up a project with higher goals, my opinion is that it also doesn't belong at that codebase. So there was the name Not Yet Xulux, in short NYX.
NYX, pronounced with a dutch tongue in Holland, actually translates to the enlgish word nothing (which I hope this will not end up as that ;)). According to the website Greek Methology Link Nyx is this :

p.b: Nyx is Night, a powerful goddess whose dark light falls from the stars, and who dictates not only to men but also to gods. Even Zeus does not wish to upset Night
